refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_ok_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a simple message dialog.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_dialog_parented ()

warning.para: gnome_ok_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a simple message dialog.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_error_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_error_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a error dialog. This is an OK dialog to display on fatally failed operations.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_error_dialog_parented ()

warning.para: gnome_error_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a error dialog. This is an OK dialog to display on fatally failed operations.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_warning_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_warning_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a warning dialog. For non-fatal warnings.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_warning_dialog_parented ()

warning.para: gnome_warning_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a warning dialog. For non-fatal warnings.

listitem.simpara: Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_question_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_question_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a question dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'Yes', 1 for 'No'
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_question_dialog_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_question_dialog_parented (const gchar *question, GnomeReplyCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_question_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a question dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'Yes', 1 for 'No'
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_question_dialog_modal ()

warning.para: gnome_question_dialog_modal is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a question dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'Yes', 1 for 'No'. The dialog is created as a modal dialog and the user will have to answer this before proceeding.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_question_dialog_modal_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_question_dialog_modal_parented (const gchar *question, GnomeReplyCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_question_dialog_modal_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a question dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'Yes', 1 for 'No'. The dialog is created as a modal dialog and the user will have to answer this before proceeding.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates an OK/Cancel dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'OK', 1 for 'Cancel'.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_parented (const gchar *message, GnomeReplyCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates an OK/Cancel dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'OK', 1 for 'Cancel'.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_modal ()

warning.para: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_modal is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates an OK/Cancel dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'OK', 1 for 'Cancel'. The dialog is created as a modal dialog and the user will have to answer this before proceeding.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_modal_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_modal_parented (const gchar *message, GnomeReplyCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_ok_cancel_dialog_modal_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows an OK/Cancel dialog and calls callback when user answers the button number is passed onto 'reply'. 0 is for 'OK', 1 for 'Cancel'. The dialog is created as a modal dialog and the user will have to answer this before proceeding.
void (* GnomeReplyCallback)(gint reply, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: Callback function for handling dialog results
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.

refsect2.title: gnome_request_string_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_request_string_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated, use gnome_request_dialog

refsect2.title: gnome_request_string_dialog_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_request_string_dialog_parented (const gchar *prompt, GnomeStringCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_request_string_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated, use gnome_request_dialog

refsect2.title: gnome_request_password_dialog ()

warning.para: gnome_request_password_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated, use gnome_request_dialog instead.

refsect2.title: gnome_request_password_dialog_parented ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_request_password_dialog_parented (const gchar *prompt, GnomeStringCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_request_password_dialog_parented is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated, use gnome_request_dialog.

refsect2.title: gnome_request_dialog ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gnome_request_dialog (gboolean password, const gchar *prompt, const gchar *default_text, const guint16 max_length, GnomeStringCallback callback, gpointer data, GtkWindow *parent);

warning.para: gnome_request_dialog is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates and shows a GNOME text entry request dialog. callback is called when the dialog closes, passing the text entry input or NULL if the user cancelled. callback is defined as
void (* GnomeStringCallback)(gchar * string, gpointer data);

listitem.simpara: TRUE if on-screen text input is masked
Text of the prompt to be displayed
Default text in entry widget, NULL if none
Callback function for handling dialog results
Parent window, or NULL for no parent.
Pointer to new GNOME dialog object.
